Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay.”
Reviews.Author: debstcharles
Reviews.Content: If you want a serene environment, this is your place. It's off the main strip and across the river so every time you went anywhere it was a several miles to reach the main drag. But it provided a quiet atmosphere. We learned they offer four types of condos here. Our friends stayed in the Lodge condos. They were cramped and you could hear noises from the other condos. We stayed in the President condos and they were large and bright. We never heard anyone else except when they moved in and the door slammed. Our condo had washer and dryer and a fireplace, theirs did not. The other two levels of condos were larger than ours. The main pool was very nice, but the hot tub wasn't hot. Oddly, the sign said not to get in it if the temp was over 104 degrees but we never saw a thermometer to tell you want the temp was in the first place. The food at the Grille was moderate price and good quality. I agree with others that the condos could use a good cleaning. We had them come and mop the kitchen floor because we wiped them down once and they were filthy. We asked for them to clean the dust hanging down from the vents but housekeeping said that was the job of maintaince so we told them to wait until we checked out. The air was hard to control in the unit. We froze in the living room, were comfortable in the master bedroom and the second lock out bedroom was warm. Maintaince said it happens in those units and they had told management about it. When we remarked on it upon check out they knew about the situation but I guess they don't plan on fixing the problem. If you needed any kitchen equipment they were very quick to supply it. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice decor, close to Historic Downtown Branson!”
Reviews.Author: alr464
Reviews.Content: Nicely decorated condo with comfy bed & furniture. Nice one man hot tub. Only one exterior hottub though. Front desk staff had zero personality, made you feel like a bother! Ice cream social on Mon. W/2 $25 gift cards given away! I won! Room was dusty w/cobwebs on the ceiling.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad...”
Reviews.Author: MrsPittKy
Reviews.Content: Holiday Hills at first glance appears to be an older property. The rooms were not bad, the only down side was in the 2 bedroom condo, there was only room for 4 people to sit in the living room so when the whole family was gathered in the living room, one person had to sit in a diningroom chair that was clearly there more for looks than comfort. Other than that, the location was great and the views were good. The pool wasn't bad, it was pretty crummy that it was only open until 10pm.

Reviews.Title: “Nice play to stay, but small pool”
Reviews.Author: seejuliego
Reviews.Content: Overall, great visit. However, the pool is way too small for the location. It was always packed! They could use a pool at least twice the size. Also, the activity center food was not good. Luckily, it is close to a grocery store. Not too far from Branson Landing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort”
Reviews.Author: Just A
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect. We arrived and within 15 minutes we were checked in. Expected a 1 bedroom with a partial kitchen but we were upgraded and received a 2 bedroom suite with a full kitchen. Staff was friendly and helpful. Anything we needed they were very prompt. We will return. Swimming pool was very clean as were all the grounds on the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Lbailey911
Reviews.Content: This place is a dump. The decor is "rustic" with furniture that has seen better days. The fixtures in the rooms were dusty. Toilet seat in the main bathroom didn't fit the toilet. It always felt like it was going to come off of the seat. No washing machine/dryer. Our toaster was broken, they did replace that. Noisy neighbors above. The bed was saggy and uncomfortable. No curtains, just blinds in our room. As soon as the sun was up, so were we. When my mother in law booked this condo, she was promised a handicapped unit. When she called the Monday before we left, she was told they did not have any handicapped units and could not give her a room on the first level. She was told their policy is that handicapped people must be in a handicapped room. There are no elevators here either. She had to cancel her reservation and find lodging elsewhere. This occurred, but at a much greater expense due to the late booking and it being a holiday/special event week. Their customer service is lacking and I'm sure they violated some ADA law somewhere in this entire fiasco. I will not recommend this venue as a place to stay. Go somewhere much nicer, like the French Quarter. We stayed there last year and it was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our condo!”
Reviews.Author: rbwildcat
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week's stay at Holiday Hills and loved every minute of it! We stayed in a Presidential unit with a Friday check in. We had reserved a 2 bedroom unit, but actually had a 1 bedroom with a lockout unit. It was perfect for our teenage daughters, who enjoyed their own space. This unit slept 6.....2 bedrooms and a sofa bed in the living room. It was very spacious and had everything we needed. The kitchen was fully stocked and there was a washer & dryer as well. We had 2 big bathrooms with jacuzzi tubs in both. Our only complaint was that there was no shower! The tubs had hand held shower nozzles, but they were awkward to use. Elderly people or people with limited mobility would have difficulty getting in & out of the tubs and it would be difficult to bathe young children in these tubs as well. The condo was nicely decorated, with kind of a rustic cabin feel. The resort has several pools, one which was right by our building. It was pretty small and often crowded. The larger pool is by the golf course and was very nice, though it could get pretty full, too. There were signs posted saying no smoking or alcoholic beverages allowed. I didn't notice any rule breakers in the big pool, but lots of smoking & drinking in our small pool. I wish management would patrol that a little closer. The smoking was annoying! This is a very large resort and you do need to drive to get to most areas. The golf course looked beautiful and was very reasonably priced. We didn't pack our clubs....no room since we traveled with teenage daughters :-) The resort is a little off the beaten path, but we enjoyed that! We didn't hear the hustle & bustle of Branson. It is easy to get to Branson Landing; everyplace else was a bit of a jaunt especially if you're trying to avoid traffic on the strip. We enjoyed our stay and will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fun time for Family”
Reviews.Author: ImpalaTommy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week and enjoyed the quiet, nice pool, easy access to Branson attractions. The room was just right for us, not too large or small. We had adjoining units so our sons family were in the adjoining larger room, and the two of us had the smaller room. Everything was available to cook our meals, including charcoal grills just outside our door, which we used often. The staff was helpful, friendly, and units were very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, very quiet.”
Reviews.Author: Squeezer2012
Reviews.Content: We loved our week here. Rarely heard more than the singing of the birds. No traffic noise or people noise, just silence. Rated service as average because we didn't need or use any of their services. Unit was very clean. Beautiful golf course, very reasonable greens fees that included cart with GPS.

Reviews.Title: “Presidential units excellant stay!”
Reviews.Author: Melissa19730_0
Reviews.Content: Two families totaling 7 people...plenty of room! Have stayed at many resorts...great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely decorated unit, but overall disappointing experience”
Reviews.Author: Ispeak4u
Reviews.Content: First the positive: Free cookies on weekend days Nicely-decorated units Decent selection of free movies at the small theater in the activity center Two things brought this from a five-star to a two-star: ALL POOLS AND HOT TUBS WERE CLOSED UNTIL MAY 1st Unbelievable for any timeshare but especially in this huge 'village' of timeshares. We count on the pool and hot tub as a major part of our vacation experience so that was a huge, huge downer. OLD TELEVISIONS, AND NO DVD PLAYER OR VCR We're used to flat screens at timeshares; the TV in our second unit [we moved] was good enough; however, the charge to rent a DVD player was $6 plus tax per day! So much for Netflix movies we'd taken with us. This is more of a small town than a resort; from many units, you'd have to drive to get over to the main office and activity center. It was easy to get lost trying to find either your unit or the exit to the main highway. No free internet in rooms [although most timeshares charge for in-room internet]; access in registration/activity building which closed at 8 p.m., so people sat in the laundry room until wee small hours of the morning. No free printing or free computer to use; you could borrow a laptop from the activity center to use on site for 15 minutes to print out boarding passes, coupons, etc., but at 50 cents per page, it wasn't worth it for cheapo discount coupons like you get in Branson. Most timeshares have at least a couple of computers you can use and print from without cost in the main building. Small short-order restaurant on site; convenient, but it turned out to not be poorer quality than fast-food restaurants, and overpriced. No laundry facilities in unit. [Many timeshares provide in-unit facilities and detergent.] Our first unit was in the lodge, I think they were accommodating our request for a ground floor unit if possible. The apt. was nicely decorated, but very dark, cramped; tiny kitchen, and hard for four of us to fit in the two-bedroom unit without tripping on each other. In our bedroom, there was little storage space. The TV cabinet was devoid of its original content, leaving a huge ugly gaping hole staring at you whenever you went in the bedroom, with a tiny television perched high on top of it. The coathangers were so high that even my six-foot husband couldn't deal easily with the devices you had to connect the hangers to; I could not use it at all, and there was no footstool available [I asked for one.] TV in other rooms was also old, and bathroom in master suite was tiny. The next day, since some of our party were leaving, we sought to switch to just a one-bedroom unit, if it had bigger living space and were nicer. The management very kindly and with no grief let us move to a much newer and larger unit near the Activity Center. It was on the third floor and a bit difficult for my husband and me to haul everything up to, but it was so much nicer as to be worth the knee pain to go up and down. It had very nice decor and much more light. The resort is a few miles out of town, yet not in a particularly attractive spot; inconvenient since one had to drive around Lake Taneycomo since there wasn't a bridge over it to get to most places. There are no recycling bins on site and no info about recycling, yet a great emphasis on careful use of towels. No replacement for shampoo, soap, etc. without buying it. If you wanted midweek cleaning, you had to call to have it scheduled. In all, it seemed like the resort was trying to milk everything it could out of those who stay there. The staff was exceedingly pleasant and cooperative

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort, beautiful unit, light on activities”
Reviews.Author: Jennski881
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in a new ambassador unit. We had a 3 bedroom unit. New and gorgeous. Not sure fancy, they have laminate counters and white appliances, but other than that top notch. Nice jacuzzi and lovely decor. They have different phases of developments, I'm sure the concerns are about the older lodge style units. Would have appreciated a luggage dolly for each building. Not a lot to do at the resort for kids, but great place for golf.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Stay All The Way--Wouldn't Recommend it To My Worst Enemy”
Reviews.Author: nooxfordforme
Reviews.Content: We checked into the Holiday Hills Resort. It was raining. It took us 2 hours to find the place because they had the mailing address in the resort book, not the street address. Dumb!!! Then, we hauled our luggage up to the 3rd floor using stairs and the blonde bimbo at the desk gave us the wrong keys. My husband had to go all the way back to get the right keys. They should have brought them to us! We got into the room and there were silverfish in the dishes on the counter. They gave us another condo and there was a real funky smell in it. We changed again (all this in the rain, mind you) and the 3rd condo seemed OK--until we returned from seeing shows. There was a guy below us smoking cigars until 1 a.m. or so and blasting loud music. I didn't bring my clean clothes to go there and have them smell like stinky cigar smoke. Then he would say, Oh, are you back? I think someone at the resort put him up to it. He talked on the phone out there until 1 a.m. also. There is a "lights out" policy at the resort. I can't understand why security doesn't take any action. I was going to take things into my own hands and drop water balloons on him, but he checked out. He's sure lucky. I am the water balloon queen. LOL. I will NEVER spend my money in this town again unless we stay at the other resort. Here's the other problem, although, not the fault of the resort: a cement truck drove by every 20 minutes because they were repairing the bridge. I didn't get a wink of sleep. The weather was great and we could have opened windows, but had to run the air conditioning. I was very upset about this as it drives up OUR maintenance costs. I contacted the chamber of commerce about it. They are running the trucks at night to avoid the daytime traffic. Well bull-oney! What about tourism. What about our gas money to go there for a wasted stay? That wrecked it for us. Never, never again!!! I never took a vacation all these years, maybe I was wise. I'm better off staying home and fixing up my house and enjoying it, rather than putting my happiness in the hands of idiots. Something to chew on.

Reviews.Title: “It was a nightmare with poor service and poor accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Melinda19
Reviews.Content: My mom is an owner here so she wanted to take us and show us the property, which she also has not seen for the first time. She has had a long history of problems with Silver Leaf properties, the ownership company, and this was no different. First our lodge unit was old, and the air conditioning was clearly not working. Mind you this was during an incredible heat wave. One room was freezing, while the master bedroom was incredibly stuffy. We complained, they came and said they fixed it, but they did not. We made it through the night and then when I got up to make coffee I found ants crawling on the kitchen counter, the walls, on the cinammon rolls I bought for breakfast and I was horrified. I complained and no one apologized not once. All they did was give us another room -- of the same quality. Yes the air worked but I was stunned no one apologized or even offered an upgrade. I would never go back or recommend it either.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice large 2 bedroom”
Reviews.Author: goingonahotholiday
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a large two bedroom which was a lock out unit. The smaller side had a king bed, tv, small fridge, microwave, sink, little counter and cupboard space, table and chairs and a nice large bathroom with double sinks. The large side had a full kitchen, dinning room, living room, washer and dryer, large master with a king bed and access to the bathroom. We had a great time. They were having a heat wave so we were glad to have indoor stuff to do. The activity center had some arcade type games, pool table, ping pong, lots of games to rent and they showed movies numerous times a day. The staff we dealt with were all friendly and knowledgeable. Doris in the concierge was nice and helpful. We would go back and would recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “spacious presidential condos”
Reviews.Author: kntheboys
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in a 2 bedroom, presidential condo during the week between Christmas and New Year's 2010. Our family of 6 had plenty of room to spread out and relax. The kitchen was plenty big and had the expected appliances. I would only request more than service for 6, since every time we ate a meal, we needed to wash the plates, forks, etc. The living room had very comfortable, large furniture-- a love seat, couch, and arm chair with a very large coffee table. They were changing out the tv's in some of the units as we were leaving, but ours still had the old style tvs. Both bathrooms had a corner jacuzzi tub/shower and double vanity. And both bedrooms had king beds with an exterior door as well as interior door (to the living room). The staff was helpful and friendly, the fitness room was fairly large with a couple treadmills, elliptical, recumbant bike, exercise bike, weight machine and free weights. The activity center has a neat little theater where they show movies (new release dvds) 3 times per day for free. The kids played arcade games, pool, ping pong, and foosball. There are about 4 leather couches in the lobby area as well for sitting and relaxing. The only downside was that wifi is only available in the activity center/lobby building, which was a drive from our condo.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Nothing Exceptional..but for the first trip, not so bad.”
Reviews.Author: tchrmom777
Reviews.Content: We were able to stay at Holiday Hills with friends. We stayed in a two bedroom and found the accommodations satisfactory. There were a few little glitches in the room, slow coffee pot, strange shower attachment within the jacuzzi tub, small screen televisions, thin ceilings..we were on the second floor and heard all the running and walking above us for the weekend...but all in all not a bad experience. If you want to be out beyond the hustle and bustle of Branson, this is the place for you. If you prefer being closer to the "strip" you will have to drive through downtown Branson and be involved in traffic to get into shows, etc. I personally would have preferred closer, but maybe the noise would have been a bother had that occurred. A clean place with a lovely pool and nice clubhouse of sorts. It was a nice place to stay for the first time in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER stay again”
Reviews.Author: sstables
Reviews.Content: Feet were black from walking around in room which I have always done in others resorts and never had this problem. The furniture was very worn along with cabinets. They try to have it hid by some of the "worn" look on the cabinets already, but this was peeling paint, etc. There was SO much dust under the beds it was appauling and we found things under the bed as my kids had dropped some things as they do. There was toilet paper looking debris that was in the small pool by the "lodge" rooms that we had gotten out and put it on the deck to have them clean up and it was two days later before it was. There was broken glass on the patio where there is the small playground by the grill that remained there throughout the trip. My kids saw a wasp nest and we reported it and it was not taken care of when we left two days later also. I have been staying in timeshare resorts for over 15 years and this is the FIRST time I never had housekeeping come in once during our stay. I had to go get the garbage bags and dish soap from the front desk as that was also a first. For being a gold crown I was VERY disappointed. From the people who stayed at the Ambassador and Presidential, there was nothing but praise so two huge differences from where you stay. The lodge side is the low rent side and they treat you like it. You are a LONG ways away from everyone. Don't bother with their conceirge service either as you can get tickets elsewhere cheaper. You had to go to the Welcome Center to use internet so be prepared to drive if you are a ways away or walk to it. I could keep going but just get ill thinking that I had a week of no sleep, filth that we avoided the room and I was wanting to leave but my husband said the kids were having a fun time and to suck it up for them. I

Reviews.Title: “Great location with acceptable accomodations”
Reviews.Author: hugbandit7
Reviews.Content: I own a timeshare at this resort and thought it would be nice to actually stay here vs. trading it in for another location. Plus I thought it would be good to see what I had purchased with friends. Overall the resort looks nice and the people were very nice that worked there. When we needed more soap and toilet paper, we received it pretty quickly. They also were not push about us doing the timeshare presentation....I already own there,why would I buy another unit?! The unit we stayed in is a lodge or "budget friendly" (according to Silverleaf's website - also means no w/d in the unit) with 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms. There is room for 6 if 2 people sleep on the pull out couch. However, it would be rather crowded if you did have 6 adults, not too bad if it included several children. The kitchen was small but sufficient to make breakfast each morning and dinner several nights. I was disappointed to see that a previous guest had set a hot pot on the formica and left a burn mark and that the resort had not fixed this yet. The bed in the master bedroom was also not comfortable. To me it was as hard as a rock and made sleeping difficult and I woke up sore many mornings. This is also the first resort that I have stayed at that did not offer beach/pool towels. Only the main pool had towels available and they are very small and thin. All of this aside, the location of the resort is perfect. It is 3 miles from Branson, a very quick drive (even with some construction) to get to downtown Branson and the mall area. A few more miles and you are on the strip with all of the theaters and museums. If I could give this resort a 1/2 star, I would have rated it 3.5 vs. 3. I didn't think it deserved 4 stars but it is a little better than 3.

Reviews.Title: “Great quiet golfers heaven near downtown Branson”
Reviews.Author: chriskre
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on an RCI exchange. The resort has no stairs so if that is an issue make sure you call the resort beforehand. They are very accomodating to help you if they can. We stayed in a lodge unit in the golf section in a 2 bedroom lock off unit.. The units are decorated in a lovely wilderness/fishing motif in keeping with the Branson area. The resort is within 2-3 miles of Downtown Branson and the Landings area. This seems to be the older section of Branson and this is the only timeshare in the area. The grounds are beautiful in this resort if you stay on the golf course side. There are two areas to this resort. The first one you encounter is the Reception building with a few lodge units which isn't the most attractive area. Then a little further down the road is the golf course area which is just beautiful. Rolling hills, a little brook, security guarded, and some nice presidential units. They have a public golf course with a grille that is convenient. The resort also has an RV park but I believe it's for owners use only. The resort also allows pets but you must be an owner for that also. The room we stayed in was newly remodeled and smelled like new construction. Very comfy beds but the master bathroom layout was a bit awkward. A jacuzzi tub in the room and a very small water closet for the toilet. The condo was maybe 700 sq. feet so it was tight for 2 bedrooms and 2 baths. It had a small kitchen but was stocked with everything you needed for cooking a few basic meals. There is not washer and dryers in the units but they do have a few laundry facilities thru out the property which are not free. The main reception area has wi-fi but it is not available thru out the resort. They close at 9pm so you have to get there early to use the wi-fi or sit in the laundry room 24/7. There is a little upscale grocery store across from the resort which was convenient. The pools were not heated so too cold for me to swim just yet. Most northerners wouldn't be bothered by it. The pools were a bit disappointing given the cute themeing of the rest of the resort. I'm not sure why they don't do something with these fiberglass pools and theme them a bit. It's like the pools were just an afterthought to say that they have one. Our unit was very clean and everything seemed to be in good working condition. I'd go back again if I needed to stay near the downtown area but after staying our second week in Branson Mountain Vista, I'd rather stay there instead since it's closer to table rock lake.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and things to do!”
Reviews.Author: sophieonvacation
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the lodges adjacent to the Members center. Our unit was great. We had all the pots and dishes we needed for cooking for a week.Our unit was very clean and check in staff were very friendly. There is a grocery store right across the street. However, the weather was not so good the first few days we still had a great time. Great place for golfing, tennis and bowling. There is a bowling alley right next to the resort. We did heear a little bit of noise from the floor above us but that family had a 3 and 4 year old so you could hear them moving around sometimes. But like living in an apartment that can be expected. Really enjoyed our stay and plan on going back this summer if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Hills comfortable& Friendly”
Reviews.Author: RMessey
Reviews.Content: This resort was friendly and maintained well. The golf course is short but calleging and was aerated but in good condition since they just got 12 inches of rain in the last 3 days. They have a great game room for the kids. The location is nice because it is outside of all the attractions but very close to drive to & from almost everything. We ate at the Candlestick Inn that was recommended just 1/2 mile away on the bluff and it was excellent. It was more expensive but had great views and atmosphere. ( Not a family resaurant) Overall I would go back and stay and hope for drier days before we get there.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the old town Branson stay”
Reviews.Author: xepwmm
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay of you are interested in the Landing, Downtown Branson. It is 30 min+ from Silver Dollar City Depending on traffic Great mini golf, goo pool (outdoor only), good golf

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Location and rooms”
Reviews.Author: shaiks
Reviews.Content: Everything from Check-in to Check-out for a week was awesome. We stayed in the lodge units. They are very nice units, we had two bedrooms, with most of the things you need for a week long stay. Kitchen was adequately stocked with utensils, bathrooms were clean. We used the second swimming pool close to our unit and it was little bit dirty since it was outdoors. There are two pools and both are outdoor. This resort is located in a quiet and peaceful corner of Branson, it’s about 5 minutes drive from Branson downtown/Branson Landings and about 10 minutes from the strip. The registration staff was very courteous and friendly. There is no wireless internet connection in the units, you need to go to (drive) the reception area to use wireless internet connection.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: mitstmp07
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful area of Branson. It's a little out of town but it's quieter that way. The largest pool and hot tub is centralized. Other condo areas has smaller pools but they are deeper than 5 feet. The condos are very clean and comfortable. There was an apt. style washer and dryer available in the the room. We never heard voices from our neighbors (or tvs) but occasionally the kids staying above us could be heard running or jumping. Grills were supplied at each condo site too. There is an activity center that showed free current movies. An arcade was available too. We'd stay here again when returning to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “This was the best place I've ever stayed.”
Reviews.Author: AJV62
Reviews.Content: Even though we were guests of the condo owner, this was the best place I've ever stayed, making this the best vacation I've ever had. The room was wonderful, the view off the back deck of the woods was peaceful. The rooms are so well insulated that I never was aware of the other occupants in the building.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed from Iowa”
Reviews.Author: bdiowa
Reviews.Content: We exchanged our timeshare week w/RCI to Holiday Hills. Very friendly staff and check in went very smooth. However, they put us in the very worn and old Presidential building - Bldg D. Room smelled musty and smoky. Called housekeeping about burned out ceiling lights and room smell. They promptly responded and changed the furnace filter, gave us some room spray, and replaced the light bulbs. One of the toilet stools kept running which they tried to fix, but couldn't get resolved during our stay. NOTE: these units have only step in whirlpool type tubs with hand held shower sprayer. Elderly would have difficult time as no grab bars available and the step over is quite high. We would not recommend Bldg. D

Reviews.Title: “People from the north east expect too much.”
Reviews.Author: moquin0616
Reviews.Content: That was what we were told when we complained about the following things: first the toilet seat came off in my husband's hand when he first walked into the unit and used the bathroom. Next we tried to turn the television on in the master bedroom and the remote did not work so we had to stick our finger in a hole where the on button should be. Finally the fitted sheets don't fit and by the time you wake up in the morning you are on the mattress. I don't sleep directly on my mattress at home and definitely don't want to sleep on a mattress at a resort. When we complained about the television I was asked if there was another one in the unit we could use and when I complained about the sheets we were handed a bag with clean sheets. The new ones weren't much better.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time - wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: carriemc95
Reviews.Content: We exchanged our week for this resort as we were meeting family members half way for a sort of mini family reunion. We had three units right next to each other. We used to travel to Branson every summer when I was a kid, so it was a little like a "going home" week. The resort location was perfect. It was away from the strip and the traffic that comes with it, but close enough that it wasn't out of the way. Branson Landing was very close with a good Bass Pro Shop there. In regards to the hotel itself - I agree with previous reviews that there really isn't much insulation between floors. We listened to the people above us go back and forth until about 11pm each night. The only other negative is the shower. The shower in the master bath is a jacuzzi tub with mirrors all around....not a pretty sight at times! LOL But the temperature knobs and the shut on/off is located OUTSIDE the curtain which makes it very akward. We only made it to the smaller pool, but some other people in our party went to the larger one and said it was nice as well. The decorations were cute, and I liked the tile floor a lot. It was a very comfortable stay. Should we decide to come to Branson again, I would stay here in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: Cherry L
Reviews.Content: We stayed in building F and it was excellent. It had one king bed with a whirlpool bathtub. The sofa made into a queen bed. There is also another queen bed with a full bath as an adjoining room. The condo is pet friendly with a deposit. There is a laundry center a few buildings down the road. The golf course was in the back yard. This resort was only 2.5 miles from downtown Branson. A must go place is Branson Landing along the lake in old downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort with just a few minor problems”
Reviews.Author: pandd1
Reviews.Content: This resort is in a really great location just a few miles from the strip of Branson. We stayed here from Dec 22nd – Dec 29th and had a very nice stay. We were in building P in the presidential suites and stayed on the 3rd floor (A&B). The rooms were very comfortable with king sized beds, HUGE Jacuzzi spa tubs, full kitchen with a few cooking utensils and a lovely fireplace that starts the fire at the flip of a switch. The views were amazing as were most of the people that worked here. As with any place you stay at for a week, you’re bound to run into a few problems. Our first problem was with the carbon monoxide and fire alarms. When we first arrived in our condo, the pressure from opening the door made one of the windows in the kitchen come open because the wind was blowing SO hard outside. So it made the room FREEZING cold when we finally got in. No big deal, we fixed it the best we could until maintenance got there to make sure it wouldn’t pop open again. And why did we need maintenance other than the window? Because my parents’ room in the condo next door had a broken phone and their carbon monoxide alarm was going off. Supposedly they just popped in a new battery to fix the alarm. However, the VERY last day we were there, their alarm went off again…this time at TWO IN THE MORNING! The maintenance guy said that the previous guy must have put in a battery that wasn’t even new. Nice, huh? Well, we had the same situation in our room too. We came back on Christmas Eve (was out getting groceries) to our alarm going off like crazy. Maintenance just popped in another battery and it took them almost 20 minutes to get there too. So, I would suggest asking ahead of time that the resorts make sure that the alarms are working properly because waking up in the middle of the night to this horrid alarm is not fun. Oh…and one morning at around 9ish, the building across the way from us (building N) got a wake-up call from the FIRE ALARM! Everyone was standing outside in their PJ’s wrapped in blankets. Oh…I’m sure they just had to change the battery on that one too. It was finally fixed about 30 minutes later. You would think that they would check all these out before they have any guests. I have never experienced such a place with so many alarms going off…and all of them being FALSE!! My next complaint is the fact that all the dishes that were in the washer in my parents’ unit were STILL DIRTY!! EW!!! So my parents had to do a load before they had some clean dishes. You also have to provide your own laundry detergent and dryer sheets because there aren’t ANY complimentary ones. Another complaint is the smoker down the stairs from us. We were good the first couple of days and then somebody moved in downstairs and their cigarette smoke somehow flowed into our BATHROOM and for the last few days of our stay, our bathroom REEKED of smoke. GAG!!! It nearly made me sick it was so heavy. They shouldn’t put smokers below non-smokers because the smoke has to go somewhere. My last complaint is with the lady who was supposed to offer you the “deals” of the city. We went down there on the afternoon of Dec 23rd specifically to talk to whomever about Silver Dollar City and this lady was downright RUDE to us! She really acted like she didn’t want to be there and was so snippy with us it really got to me. I was trying to be very friendly with her and chit-chat about the offers and I guess I “interrupted” her in one of her “talks” and she held up her finger at me to hush me up. WHAT THE???? I have NEVER been treated this way by someone who is supposed to be HELPFUL to the guests. I took my brochures and decided to go elsewhere for information. I didn’t want ANY of her deals. I was going to complain to the resorts about this HORRIBLE lady, but my husband didn’t want to make a big deal about it since it was the beginning of our holiday. So I decided I was just going to inform everybody about her here. I didn’t catch her name, but like I said before, she was working in the afternoon on Sunday, the 23rd. This resort should really find somebody who is more PEOPLE FRIENDLY!! Everybody else we dealt with on this trip was super-nice and made the whole trip wonderful. BOO to this lady!! Other than Miss. Grinch there and the icky smoker, we had a very nice stay. I would definitely recommend it and would definitely stay there again. I would just check with the office and make sure there are ALL new batteries in all of the alarm systems. AND make sure that I’m not next to any smokers. Also, if you are looking for good deals for any shows and attractions, just find a place in the city itself. There are helpful people at almost ANY place. Do not go to this place for your tickets.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: nanasal
Reviews.Content: We were at Holiday Hills from 12/1-12/7 2007 through RCI in a President's Unit comprised of an A and a B unit.We thought it was a beautiful resort with many amenities including a golf course for those interested. Welcome Center staff were very nice and the units were immaculate. Wireless internet is available in the WC. Coffee seemed to be ever present along with delicious cookies most of the time also. Branson tickets are available at the WC through an outside company. They honor any discount coupons.We arrived after dark and had to pull in 3 times before we found our building due to unlit signs at the top of the buildings. The newer row of buildings, across the street from us ,had bigger signs with a spotlight on them. A minor complaint is lack of a walkin shower-just a hand shower in the jacuzzi tub in both units. Beds and furniture were very comfortable. We were offered a free midweek cleaning if desired. It is about 3 miles from the strip and at times, traffic was quite heavy. We had a wonderful time in Branson and would certainly return to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “We will go elsewhere next time”
Reviews.Author: FRSSpringfield_MO
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a week stay at this resort. Upon arrival, the unit had an unusual lump under the rug, the coffee pot did not work, the jet-tub did not work, light bulbs were out, and most of all the air conditioning was out. We arrived on Friday - it was Wednesday before we were given another unit because the repair staff was too busy or forgot. The days were hot and humid, so we could not stay in our unit. At night, it cooled down enough to sleep at about 10:30 p.m. but only if we left the deck/patio doors open. Enough was going on outside to keep us from sleep until midnight. We approached the management every day, sometimes twice a day and were always told someone was on it. Finally one person said that they had other units available and that we should have been switch immediately. Too late for this years vacation...

Reviews.Title: “great family vacation at holiday hills”
Reviews.Author: jzuber
Reviews.Content: We actually fell into our weeks stay at the Silver leaf's Holiday hills resort. We bid on an RCI auction for a silver leaf resort. We were amazed at how great everything was. We were given a 1 bdrm unit at the presidental fairway. It was totally fine for us with 2 small children as they loved sleeping on the couches! The unit was well appointed with dishes/pots pans, dishwasher, soap, scrubbies, garbage bags, and all small appliances (so bring your coffee/filters). It also had a small washer/dryer, and even a whirlpool tub! Outside it had patio furniture and a charcoal grill. We took advantage of most they had to offer. We did the crafts, bingo, gameroom, used the playground and the pools. We also golfed at the course. They gave us a great rate of $25 for 18 holes since we were staying there which included a cart. The normal public rate is $65. They do have junior rates available. We also noticed they moved the holes so that no 2 days golfing would be exactly the same. On a side note, they do require a collared shirt to golf there. We did have a few small issues upon check in, which were taken care of within a 1/2 hr and followed up by a courtesy call to see if everything else was ok. We thought we might be treated differently since we were not timeshare owners at this resort, but everyone was friendly and helpful and treated everyone the same. We also used the Branson concierge in the lobby for our attraction tickets to save some time and $$. We did experience some noise from the people walking around in the unit above ours, but most nights we were so tired we fell asleep anyway. We liked the fact that we were off of the strip and could take the bypass roads and even though it took usually 10-15 minutes to get places, it would take even longer if you were on the strip and traffic was backed up. We can not even think about a vacation in a standard hotel room with a family after experiencing a weeks stay in a condo! We will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: Katamaran
Reviews.Content: Having booked this resort through RCI, we were very pleased with the results. We were in one of the two bedroom (lockoff) units next to the Welcome Center. Although the unit would have been quite small for the six people it will hold, it was quite comfortable for the four of us. If you have six people, you will find it a little difficult as both bathrooms, are off of bedrooms and there is no access to either without going through the bedrooms. The unit was clean and well appointed. There were more than an adequate amount of linens, likely because these particular units do not have laundry facilities in them. The staff was very amiable and helpful. The one maintenance problem we had, was serviced in less than an hour. The resort is close to the Branson strip, without being in the area of downtown congestion. The activity center was the nicest we have found in any resort so far. We are not golfers, so cannot speak to either the golf course or the restaurant or facilities in that area of the resort. There was a pool, playground, and pavillion with multiple grills in our backyard. We would highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Great Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: soonerfan85
Reviews.Content: Stayed in one of the two bedroom lookout units in the Presidential Fairways area in the golf course portion of the resort. Beautiful wood floors with fishing camp decor. Units looked to be maybe 4 or 5 years old. Very large living room with sofa and two large club chairs and stone fireplace. The dining table would comfortably sit 8. Both bathrooms were large and included jacuzzi tubs. The only complaint I'd have, and this is only a minor inconvenience, is that there was no shower. You had to use the hand held shower in the jacuzzi, and since my wife and I are both tall, we had to sit down to shower. There was a small playground and pool nearby, but the main pool up by the golf clubhouse is much larger. There are plenty of charcoal grills available if you are inclined to grill outside. Our unit also had a small washer and dryer and the kitchen was supplied with dishes, eating utensils, cooking pans and all the stuff you'd need to prepare meals and clean up afterward. They even supplied teh dishwashing liquid, extra garbage bags and coffee. I don't know how much these units run on a nightly basis, but if competitive with others in the area I highly reccommend them. The only downside is this property is located in Hollister, so there is only one road into Branson. If there is an accident on that road between you and the bridge crossing over Lake Taneycomo, as there was one day during our stay, you'll be sitting in traffic a while until it is cleared. I didn't play the golf course, with two teeange girls on the trip there was no room in the van for unecessary stuff like golf clubs, but it looked very well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Jiggleon
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay at Holiday Hills Resort & Golf Club and it was just fantastic! We stayed in the 2 bedroom Lakes and it was just very beautiful - the condo was huge -- and that was something we needed as we had our teenaged daughter - 18 & son - 17 with us. The view of the golf course was just spectacular! The staff anticipated our every need and went out of their way to make us feel so special! The pools were gorgeous, the Activity Center was filled with Arcade games, ping pong, pool, and even a small movie theater, video and DVDs, video games -- just everything! Believe me after a day of treking all over Silver Dollar City and seeing the shows on the strip, it was just a relief to get out of all the hustle-bustle and come "home" to such a gorgeous and relaxing place. We are telling everyone we know about Holiday Hills and are hoping to come again, only this time Holiday will be our destination instead of Branson! Did I mention how "romantic" the feel of the condos were? The next time we come it will be without the kids!

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Hills Resort and Golf Club
HotelInfo.Address: 2380 Highway 76 East, Branson, MO 65616
